(Man, miss one day of posting and you miss everything ^_^)

Tavatron shook the layer of dust from her blackened and charred armor. Her 
left shoulder plate was nonexistant, leaving multiple mech-fluid covered 
wires vulnerable. Tavatron painfully rotated the joint, just to see if it 
was still functional. Fortunetly it was, but not nearly well-enough for 
close range combat.

Tavatron repositioned her staff across her back, suddenly noticing a 'bot 
the looked like Prowl standing across the clearing. Tavatron growled as she 
shut and opened her optics several times. She must have damaged her optics 
during a fall; her visoin was blurred. The smell of burnt metal and 
mech-fluid seemed to dominate the area though, which was definitely not a 
good sign.

Tavatron quickly began to walk toward the Prowl and what seemd to be a 
kneeling 'bot, her pace increasing as a feeling of urgency swept over her. 
The one thing that bothered her the most was the fact that she couldn't see 
Dinobot anywhere. He had been beside her the last time she checked, but she 
had lost sight of him some time ago. Tavatron's exposed shoulder throbbed 
painfully as she picked up her pace yet again.

A wave of nausea swept over her as she pushed her way past Prowl, only to 
stop short, her mouth partly open as if she were about to say something, 
though she couldn't think of a single thing. Half of Dinobot's armor looked 
as if it had been ripped from his body, leaving his circuits vulnerable to 
the elements. He was literally covered in mech-fluid, a sight she had grown 
accustomed to in enemies but not in friends.

Tavatron cringed as she heard Dinobot's spine snap back into place as he 
stood. She knew the stoic warrior would try to hide just how much he was in, 
but there was no hiding this time. Tavatron remained silent, not wanting to 
surprise him, if that was at all possible. Tavatron took a moment to survey 
the newly formed battleground, and did her best to quell the rising growl 
that had formed deep within her throat. This place that had held such beauty 
only cycles ago, was now reduced to a smoldering ground unfit for any 
creature.

Tavatron turned her attention back to Dinobot. She wanted to yell at him, 
ask him what the hell he had been thinking, fighting like this after losing 
so much fluid in the previous battle. Tavatron took a deep breath, she 
wasn't angry, just concerned, as always. It seemed Dinobot could never stay 
in one piece for long, especially when it came to battle. Besides, it wasn't 
her place to question his actions. She would have probably done the same 
thing given similar circumstances. Tavatron's face appeared emotionless, 
though inside she was wrought with concern:

"I suggest we leave. There's nothing left here."

Tavatron waited for a response, and to see if Dinobot needed any help. She 
wouldn't approach him, but if he asked she would gladly help him back to 
base. It was his decision, and no matter the choice she would accept and 
respect it. He was a warrior, he knew his limits.
